abstract: Shares of Alcoa rose in premarket trading Tuesday after The Times of London reported that two British-Australian mining giants were considering buying the aluminum producer. The paper said that BHP Billiton and Rio Tinto have begun examining the possibilities of a $40 billion buyout of the Pittsburgh-based company, while Alcoa has separately drawn up a list of chief executive candidates.
lead_paragraph: Shares of Alcoa rose in premarket trading Tuesday after The Times of London reported that two British-Australian mining giants were considering buying the aluminum producer. The paper said that BHP Billiton and Rio Tinto have begun examining the possibilities of a $40 billion buyout of the Pittsburgh-based company, while Alcoa has separately drawn up a list of chief executive candidates.

headline.main: Report Stokes Speculation About Alcoa Takeover
